bug.author: surendra1472
bug.summary: Null target value in the data set is giving error
bug.description:
Your Environment
Mindsdb version you tried to install:1.9.2
Describe the bug If any rows of the target column is null or empty, I am getting the following error To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior, for example:
Use the attached data set. Run the code: ...etc You should see the error: ... blah
Expected behavior A clear error message or automatically handle the null values.
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27191684/71776142-5da4ff80-2fb2-11ea-9cff-a3f22afb9f09.PNG></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/files/4022940/Target_Variable_null_error.zip>Target_Variable_null_error.zip</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hmh, I believe we should support null target variables or at least clear all rows with null target variables in mindsdb, will look into it.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/George3d6>@George3d6</denchmark-link> Please find the code and dataset to replicate the issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/files/4036195/Target_Null_error.zip>Target_Null_error.zip</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/surendra1472>@surendra1472</denchmark-link> Are you sure this was not happening due to the model not being fully trained ? since due to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mindsdb/mindsdb/issues/365>#365</denchmark-link> the code you sent me wouldn't have previously run properly on mindsdb.
